channel.title: Latest PHMSA Hazardous Materials Incident Reports, for NJ

item.title: Report X-2024041270
item.description:
Report X-2024041270

Identified by scraper @ 2024-04-26T15:12:30+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2024-04-20
  • City: KEASBEY
  • State: NJ
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: Federal Express Corporation
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Total Amount Of Damages: 0
  • Serious Incident Ind: No
  • Description: Package arrived at hazmat cage during sunrise sort in a plastic bin. Inspection showed package to be wet, torn open, and 1 of 4 items have a loose cap. Damage most likely caused from being dropped or mishandled during loading process. Remaining contents will be returned to shipper in a salvage drum, unless otherwise stated.

item.title: Report X-2024040961
item.description:
Report X-2024040961

Identified by scraper @ 2024-04-25T15:11:03+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2024-04-15
  • City: PARSIPPANY
  • State: NJ
  • Report Type: Undeclared Shipment with no Release
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: UNITED PARCEL SERVICE
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Total Amount Of Damages: 0
  • Serious Incident Ind: No
  • Description: RESPONDED TO AN AIR PACKAGE THAT WAS COLD TO THE TOUCH. UPON INSPECTION OF THE CONTENTS DISCOVERED APPROXIMATELY FOUR POUNDS OF DRY ICE COOLING FOOD. THERE ARE NO DANGEROUS GOODS MARKS OR LABELS ON THE OUTER BOX TO INDICATE DRY ICE WAS BEING SHIPPED. OUTER BOX IS PREPRINTED RUSH, PERISHABLE, INSULATED WITH UP ARROWS. THERE IS A YELLOW THERM-0-CHILL OVERNITE SHIPPERS LABEL APPLIED. INNER STYROFOAM BOX HAS A WARNING DRY ICE - DO NOT TOUCH WITH BARE HANDS LABEL AFFIXED. THIS PACKAGE HAS NOT BEEN ACCEPTED FOR AIR OR TRANSPORTED IN THE AIR BY UNITED PARCEL SERVICE CO.

item.title: Report X-2024041087
item.description:
Report X-2024041087

Identified by scraper @ 2024-04-24T15:12:15+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2024-04-17
  • City: KEASBEY
  • State: NJ
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: FEDERAL EXPRESS CORPORATION
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Total Amount Of Damages: 0
  • Serious Incident Ind: No
  • Description: DURING THE OVERNIGHT SORT THE PACKAE WAS BROUGHT TO THE HAZMAT CAGE, UPON INSPECTION ONE OF FOUR BOTTLES OF RAPICIDE WAS FOUND TO BE LEAKING CAUSED FROM A LOOSE CAP. THE REMAINING CONTENTS WERE PLACED IN A LINED SALVAGE DRUM TO BE RETURNED TO SHIPPER UNLESS OTHERWISE.
